title: Radar Roundup: Wizard Works Gala Musette, Komoot Tour Discovers Features, Daysaver Multi Tool, Natural Atlas App, Rising Up – An Everesting World Record Film, and Impossible Route Ep.4
content:
Our Radar Roundup compiles products and videos from the ‘net in an easy-to-digest format. Read on below for today’s findings…

Wizard Works Gala Musette £35

The Gala Musette, a weather resistant and durable version of a traditional musette; usette for keeping your phone to hand, carrying your watercolours to the park or just fill it with sandwiches – every zone can be a feed zone when you’re in charge of the snacks.

Partially lined and made from Cordura and X-Pac fabric to keep weight down and vibes high. Gala features an angled adjustable strap for the perfect fit and a press stud at the top to keep your snacks secure.

Available in stock or in custom colors. Made in-house, London, UK

Komoot Discover | Routes and Must-Sees Where You Are

Komoot keeps improving its UX and today, the brand announced the Routes and Must See options; a new map-based interface with best-in-class interactivity. Thanks to the new map-based interface, komoot users can now receive Tour recommendations in a specific area and compare them on a map that offers detailed route information at a glance.

Whether it’s their current location, a specific address (like public transport hubs, car parks and holiday accommodations) or a dropped pin placed on the map, users can now view the most popular routes that begin from their favourite locations. And to explore the community’s most popular places, as recommended by those who know them best, users can also see routes that include Highlights and find different start locations on the map.

Additionally, the new map interface includes animated direction markers that indicate route direction, coloured Tour lines that help distinguish between suggested routes and labelled start points that facilitate compare options.

Check out more at Komoot.

 

﻿﻿

 

Daysaver Incredible Tool on Kickstarter

“Every ride carry” multitools that hide in your steerer or handlebar end are ubiquitous these days. What’s innovative about this specific tool and why we chose to share it is the bit bundles can be customized to fit your bike. You can snap a T25 and a 4mm allen bit together if that’s all your bike has, etc. Also, the locking cam on the bar-end storage cradle is a nice touch.

Check it out in detail at Kickstarter.

Natural Atlas is a Route + Ecology App

Whether you’re hiking, bike touring, or backpacking, chances are you’ll encounter rocks, animals, and plants you are unfamiliar with. Natural Atlas can help with that by offering tools to identify geologic shifts, flora, and fauna, all while helping you navigate along the way.

Check out more at Natural Atlas.

 

﻿﻿

 

Rising Up – An Everesting World Record Film

In 2022 Ultra Cyclist Jack Thompson embarked on the impossible … To Everest once a week for an entire year (52 Everests on 52 different roads), climb a total of 1,000,000 metres of elevation and raise $1,000,000 for three charities.

Jack broke the Everesting World Record as part of his 1,000,000: A Space Odyssey Project, climbed all 1,000,000m and learned a hell of a lot about himself while raising $500,000 for charity.

‘Rising Up’ is a film of resilience, strength and overcoming adversity, it will inspire you to set your next crazy goal and then go about achieving it.

 

﻿﻿

 

No Summit In Sight

Nepal’s mysterious and undeniable beauty instantly hits you – flying across its majestic valleys and ridiculously huge mountain ranges, landing in the middle of a stunning ancient culture. For MTB-adventurer/artist Tito Tomasi, Nepal had peaked his must-see list for a long time, and it was time for some action…

 

 

Radavision

Stuff we see on the ‘net that causes pause…
